On the tenth day of the fourth month in the third year of the Xianqing era of Tang,
the master was about to pass away and said in the hall:
After my extinction, do not destroy my true Dharma eye treasury.
The Three Sages came out and said,
How dare I destroy the master's true Dharma eye treasury?
The master said,
Later, if someone asks you, what will you tell them?
The Three Sages then shouted.
The master said,
Who would have known that my true Dharma eye treasury would be extinguished at the side of this blind donkey?
He then had a verse:
Along the current, unceasingly asking how, the true illumination, boundless, speaking to others.
Apart from characteristics, apart from names, people do not receive it. After using the sword, quickly sharpen it again.
After finishing the verse, he sat and passed away.
By imperial decree, he was given the posthumous name Great Master Huizhao.
His stupa was called Clear Spirit.
